entry.title: “The Spirit of the Lord Is upon Me”

link.title: “The Spirit of the Lord Is upon Me”

entry.summary: Picture / Intro “Adam and Eva” were members of the Sabre Springs Ward. My first memory of Eva was how she boldly declared her love for “Jesus Christ” in our Chapel. Later, I spent time as their ministering brother and enjoyed this couples amazing commitment to the Gospel of Jesus. Now she is an artist and the live on the East coast. Into the Wilderness,, by Eva Koleva Timothy

entry.title: We Are Responsible for Our Own Learning

link.title: We Are Responsible for Our Own Learning

entry.summary: I am Responsible for my own Learning Elder David A. Bednar taught: “We should not expect the Church as an organization to teach or tell us everything we need to know and do to become devoted disciples and endure valiantly to the end. Here are some quotes from Come Follow Up … Lord speaks to people according to their own understanding As we study, understand the story line, characters, events In our home study, learn from each other, cater lesson to our family (younger/older children like stories) Prepare something from home study, bring that to Sunday School, take pressure off of Sunday School Teacher Make Christ the center of our study We learn when do

entry.title: Birth of Jesus Christ
entry.summary: During this Christmas season, consider how the Old Testament has strengthened your testimony of Jesus Christ throughout the year.

entry.title: Hosea, Joel, Amos, Obadiah
entry.summary: Whosoever heareth the sound of the trumpet and taketh warning shall deliver their soul.

entry.title: Jeremiah, Ezekiel and Daniel
entry.summary: Historically, Jeremiah is the prophet during the fall of Jerusalem and Ezekiel lived in captivity. Daniel was a noble Jewish youth of Jerusalem taken into captivity by Nebuchadnezzar II of Babylon.
